title: Security Graph Fundamentals - Interactive Guide
description: Learn cybersecurity through graph database analysis with step-by-step guidance

instructions.title: 🎓 Welcome to Security Graph Learning
instructions.content:
Welcome to the Cloud Threat Graph Lab!

This interactive guide will teach you how to analyze cybersecurity threats using graph databases. You'll learn:

  • 📊 Graph Theory: Nodes, relationships, and security context
  • 🔍 Attack Path Analysis: How attackers move through systems
  • 💻 Cypher Queries: Database language for security analysis
  • 🎮 Dashboard Integration: Connect learning to real scenarios
💡 Pro Tip: This same data powers the dashboard at localhost:3000. Keep it open to see connections!

instructions.title: 📊 Your First Security Analysis
instructions.content:
Let's discover what's in our security graph! This is like taking inventory of all security assets.

🔍 What this query does:

  • MATCH (n) - Find all nodes in the graph
  • labels(n)[0] - Get the type of each node
  • count(n) - Count how many of each type
  • ORDER BY Count DESC - Show most common first

🛡️ Security Insight: Asset inventory is the foundation of cybersecurity. You can't protect what you don't know exists!

✨ Try It: After running this, compare the results with your dashboard's statistics bar!

instructions.title: 🎯 Understanding Attack Paths
instructions.content:
Now for the core concept: Attack Paths! These show how attackers move through systems.

📖 Attack Path Concept:

  • A sequence of connected resources
  • Shows how attackers reach targets
  • Like a route on a map, but for cybersecurity
  • Shorter paths = easier attacks = higher risk

🔍 This Query Analysis:

  • Starts with developer users
  • Follows 1-3 relationship hops
  • Ends at services containing sensitive data
  • Shows the complete attack route
🎮 Dashboard Match: This is the SAME query as "AWS Privilege Escalation" scenario!

instructions.title: 📈 Visual Graph Analysis
instructions.content:
Let's create your first visual security graph! This helps you see relationships that are hard to spot in tables.

🎨 Visualization Benefits:

  • See attack flows visually
  • Identify security bottlenecks
  • Understand complex relationships
  • Communicate security risks clearly

🔍 Color Coding:

  • Light Blue - Users (attack starting points)
  • Orange - Roles/Permissions (escalation points)
  • Red - Sensitive Data (attack targets)
  • Light Green - Other Resources
🎯 Analysis Tip: Look for short paths from blue (users) to red (sensitive data)!

instructions.title: 🧪 Hands-On Challenge: Build Your Query
instructions.content:
🏆 Your Challenge: Write a query to find administrative access paths!

📋 Requirements:

  • Find users with access_level = 'administrator'
  • Show what roles they can assume
  • Display the access method (relationship type)

💡 Query Structure Hints:

  • Start with MATCH (user:User)-[relationship]->(role:Role)
  • Add WHERE user.access_level = ?
  • Return user name, role name, and relationship type
🎯 Learning Goal: Practice writing your own security queries!
instructions.solution:
💡 Solution:

MATCH (user:User)-[r]->(role:Role)
WHERE user.access_level = 'administrator'
RETURN 
    user.name as AdminUser,
    role.name as AdminRole,
    type(r) as AccessMethod

🔍 Explanation:

  • [r] captures the relationship
  • type(r) gets the relationship type
  • This shows how admins access different roles
